experience: You and Scott both know Cheryl Farmer
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
You both studied at Northern Arizona University from 2008 to 2010

2017: Managing 20,000sf tenant improvement project for LinkedIn, Sunnyvale, CA.  Utilized similar technology listed below.  New technology for this project included construction progress photospheres with Holobuilder.2016: Managed an 80,000sf tenant improvement project, including 50,000sf of compartmented (multi-user) SCIF space.  We leveraged technology and collaboration to construct this complex, showcase project, for the confidential client.Examples of BIM, Lean and technology we are using collaboratively with the owner, subcontractors and design team include:Technology:    - Collaborative reviews for design drawings, contracts, and other documents (Bluebeam)    - Fully electronic record drawings (PlanGrid)        *We did not print a single set of drawings from precon through construction    - Electronic Rolling Completion/Punch Lists (PlanGrid)    - Location Based Progress Photos (PlanGrid)BIM:    - Model coordination    - BIM Walks (360 Glue)        * Model based quality reviews in the field on ipad        * Measuring construction progress        * Resolving issues with the model in the field    - Laser scanning (by Gilbane VDC)    - Virtual Reality tours (by Gilbane VDC)        *Photorealistic models for display on Samsung Gear VR headsetsLean:    - Pull Planning Scheduling Sessions    - Coordination Board    - Electronic project management system (Gilbane's "iBuild")
Building efficiency into every step of the preconstruction process by using, creating and implementing cutting edge technology and processes.

Highlights:- Developed and improved upon the innovative technologies and processes Gilbane uses to efficiently and effectively manage every aspect of the construction process.- BIM Walks: Developed processes to utilize the building information model in the field, to perform quality reviews with the intent of resolving potential issues before they occur, with the goal of improving the overall quality and performance of the structure, and reducing costly rework.- Implemented 4D Visual Scheduling and Sequencing techniques to develop baseline schedules, analyze schedule options, and communicate work forecasts and look ahead schedules.- Building Information Modeling: Ran BIM coordination meetings on a daily basis with trade modelers, field supervisors and Gilbane MEP experts.  Utilized the model to forecast and resolve constructability issues in the job trailer or in the field.  Integrated 3D screenshots into RFIs to assist the design team in quickly making informed decisions.- Managed electronic record documents, on a daily basis, with our Gilbane team, utilizing Bluebeam and PlanGrid.- Developed and maintained project inspection, daily work and two-week schedules.- Managed every aspect of Site, Parking Structure and Sallyport construction, including sequencing (location based, pull schedules), scheduling (P6), field coordination, and site logistics.

Performed in a variety of roles, including:- Estimating- Conceptual Estimate Design Models- Virtual Design Coordination - BIM Coordination- Interdisciplinary Document Control - Constructability Reviews- Innovation, efficiency, intra-departmental coordination- Hard bid coordination- Purchasing and procurement

Worked as a field engineer, assisting the project superintendent and project manager on a variety of functions. Project Experience:- NAU Native American Cultural Center, LEED Silver- 1899 Bar and Grill, high-end steakhouse- NAU North Union Performing Arts Auditorium, remodel and upgrade of fire/life/safety
Drafted out of high school in 2002 and played professionally through 2010.

Developed company from concept.  Get Grippers currently serves customers, selling fitness products in over 30 countries.  Created marketing and sales plans that have helped grow the business from annual gross sales of $5,000 in 2003, to over $80,000 in 2008.  Managed staff in daily operations including accounting, sales, marketing, shipping and customer service.

Project Manager - NAU Heavy Civil Team - ASC Reno Competition, 2011;   Project Manager - NAU Marine Heavy Civil Team - ASC Reno Competition, 2010;   Helped to organize over 500 hours of community service 2009-2011.

Project Manager - NAU Heavy Civil Team - ASC Reno Competition, 2011;   Project Manager - NAU Marine Heavy Civil Team - ASC Reno Competition, 2010;   Helped to organize over 500 hours of community service 2009-2011.

I would highly recommend without hesitation Scott to any company hoping to grow revenues while maintaining the highest quality standards in the industry.
